I think it’s kind of funny.
My sides are splitting!

Some top notch graphic design going on there...Who follows Casino Royale on Twitter?It looks like they've changed it to 3) More beer! with a different emoji...As someone who has been following a lot of Vegas news and virus news...I've come to the conclusion that attempts at humor concerning the pandemic have in large part fallen flat.
"Anyone else think this is in extremely poor taste?"I do. This isn't a hurricane party in New Orleans....
The only excuse I can think of is they were guilty of knowing their audience too well. People who are in Las Vegas right now looking to party on St. Patricks day probably thought it was hilarious.
Not too smart
Interesting to read the different comments.
Everything about Casino Royale is in bad taste. That is it’s schtik.

“ Pretty sure it would not be appropriate to order an Irish Car Bomb, or a Black n Tan in Ireland.”Or in a lot of other places. I witnessed a cringe-worthy moment of a group of young Americans trying to order “ car bombs” in a pub in Galway. It didn’t end well.
Dang,I love it when my post riles people up. Even if factual. lol
..hey, any attention is better than none for you.
Sense of Humor-they probably were referring to the panic that people are portraying all over the place - I have a sense of humor and see nothing wrong with this
I have a sense of humor too. But somehow it’s never extended to making jokes about a virus killing old people in nursing homes. I don’t think any part of that will ever be funny to me.

"Maybe the US is just lucky,but so far this virus thing is just a blip on the radar"Such ignorant linear thought processing.Even with the massive amount of social distancing there will be 10,000's of cases in the US. It's a virtual mathematical certainty. Maybe many more. Today's numbers are almost guesses.And maybe 10,000+ compared to 340M people is tiny?Unless it is someone you know tjp?Your reasoning reminds me all too well of 6/5 bj players' rationale.Or the RF folks who can't do the math.

"Even with the massive amount of social distancing there will be 10,000's of cases in the US. It's a virtual mathematical certainty. Maybe many more. Today's numbers are almost guesses."Agree. To argue anything else is just stubborn ignorance.If even 30% of people get it and 1% of them die, that's 1,000,000 people. In what world is that a "blip" I wonder?

Many of you need to re-read my post. It reads "as of now" . No need to add futuristic wording to it just to shoot me down. On the other hand,some of you are so dang good at that behavior.lol But it is fun to read.
Starting to think if the economic impact of this is made worse by the actions taken instead of letting the virus take its course. So I guess that makes me a bad person for thinking that.
Nah...you're a bad person because of an overall lack of character, not just for one ridiculous thought. Chin up!

We are faced with balancing the need to “flatten the curve” with trying to minimize the impact on the economy.Flatten the curve. Pay attention to the new guidelines. And for those who don't like to comply, at least respect social distancing.
Thanks Slade, so basically I am a bad person since I am a douche. Not because I am thinking of the economic impact. Whew, that is a relief.
Roadtriip, I wasn't judging. I don't have enough information. I was just sending you on the road to self discovery so you can decide for yourself.
